Key Arguments: Individuals should have the freedom to choose what content they engage with.
Ordinary people are capable of discerning truth from misinformation and should conduct their own due diligence.
Censorship by any authority infringes on personal rights and freedoms.
Exposure to a wide range of content, even extreme, is essential for learning and democracy.
Existing systems on internet platforms already provide options for users to manage content they encounter.
Efforts should focus on combating direct threats like scams rather than broad censorship.
Main Themes: Focus on direct threats like scams
Notable Quotes: My freedom to choose whether to engage or move on.
Removing available information seems like a massive overreaction.
Censor what content I am exposed to seems a breach of my rights.
Access to all prospective and content is a part of democracy.
There are already options in place, should I disagree with the outcome.
